description.narrative: To promote an integrated approach to management of forests in Turkey, demonstrating multiple environmental benefits in high conservation value forests in the Mediterranean forest region

participating-org.narrative: Min. of Forest and Wat. Aff.

description.narrative: first-order administrative division
seat of a first-order administrative division

seat of a first-order administrative division
capital of a political entity

activity-description.narrative: the project will demonstrate approaches to generating, measuring, reporting on and verifying carbon, biodiversity and socio-economic benefits generated through this integrated approach at five Mediterranean forest sites (over a total area of 450,000 ha).

sector.narrative: Eradicate poverty in all its forms and dimensions

description.narrative: Implementation of forestbased GHG mitigation and carbon sequestration tools within landscape
Silvicultural methods consider carbon and biodiversity aspects Assessment of associated carbon benefits

comment.narrative: Carbon benefits not taken into account or measured locations not chosen to maximize connectivity enhancements
Silvicultural approaches at pilot sites generate carbon benefits of 11572 tCO2y along with enhanced connectivity

Locations chosen to maximize connectivity enhancements As a result of field surveys a site of 3919 ha was identified to undertake silvicultural efforts for carbon and biodiversity aspects in 2015 A carbonfocused silviculture consultant and a afforestation consultant were hired A detailed plan for carbon focused silviculture and afforestation action plan at site level with capacity of carbon stocks were prepared Activity plan at site level and forest unit level are under preparation
Silvicultural approaches at pilot sites generate carbon benefits of 11572 tCO2y along with enhanced connectivity

Locations chosen to maximize connectivity enhancements As a result of field surveys a site of 3919 ha was identified to undertake silvicultural efforts for carbon and biodiversity aspects in 2015 A carbonfocused silviculture consultant and a afforestation consultant were hired A detailed plan for carbon focused silviculture and afforestation action plan at site level with capacity of carbon stocks were prepared Activity plan at site level and forest unit level are under preparation

description.narrative: Fuel wood removals and associated carbon fluxes

comment.narrative: High levels of legal and illegal fuel wood removals for household consumption especially home heating with resulting annual carbon losses at five pilot sites averaging 18775 tCO2y No alterative system to replace fire wood consumption in place
Expansion of microcredit program into Mediterranean region generates carbon benefits of 13038 tCO2y over baseline

As per the Steering Committee meeting decision and technical workshops with related GDF departments ORKOYs microcredit programme will started after a detailed study on socioeconomic situation of forest villages within pilot sites and a technology assessment for house heating solar systems including solar water heating system are complete Terms of Reference for both services prepared and submitted to the GDF
Expansion of microcredit program into Mediterranean region generates carbon benefits of 13038 tCO2y over baseline

As per the Steering Committee meeting decision and technical workshops with related GDF departments ORKOYs microcredit programme will started after a detailed study on socioeconomic situation of forest villages within pilot sites and a technology assessment for house heating solar systems including solar water heating system are complete Terms of Reference for both services prepared and submitted to the GDF

description.narrative: Carbon protocols designed and completed before during and after implementation of enhancement and mitigation efforts

comment.narrative: No carbon protocol

Introduction of carbon protocols in line with MRV system Output 13 enabling integration of climate change into forest management plans through a central LULUCF Database under Forest Information System FIS Project of GDF

Terms of reference for a national consultant on forest management plans and a national consultant on carbon protocols are prepared and submitted to the GDF Upon technical inputs from the related departments the consultants will be hired ENVANIS system to be upgraded for carbon protocols has been elaborated through several technical workshops and meetings with the Forest Management and Planning Department of the GDF 125000 scale maps of all pilot sites with current forest management functions prepared overlapped with biodiversity data along with fire pest silviculture afforestation action plans A process for ecosystem base multifunctional planning with specific table and optimal situation for climate change and biodiversity was drafted

Introduction of carbon protocols in line with MRV system Output 13 enabling integration of climate change into forest management plans through a central LULUCF Database under Forest Information System FIS Project of GDF

Terms of reference for a national consultant on forest management plans and a national consultant on carbon protocols are prepared and submitted to the GDF Upon technical inputs from the related departments the consultants will be hired ENVANIS system to be upgraded for carbon protocols has been elaborated through several technical workshops and meetings with the Forest Management and Planning Department of the GDF 125000 scale maps of all pilot sites with current forest management functions prepared overlapped with biodiversity data along with fire pest silviculture afforestation action plans A process for ecosystem base multifunctional planning with specific table and optimal situation for climate change and biodiversity was drafted

description.narrative: Integrated pest management IPM and associated carbon fluxes

comment.narrative: No proactive IPM resulting annual carbon losses at five pilot sites averaging 45286 tCO2y
Introduction of IPM methods and establishment of two pest centres generates carbon benefits of 30191 tCO2y over baseline

Location of two pest centres identified Required activities for equipping and running of pest centres with laboratories and early warning system are in progress Site based interventions pestspecific action plans data management of integrated pest management strategy are elaborated with the Department of Pest Management A list of required equipment and training needs drafted A national Integrated Pest Management Consultant was hired Yearly intervention plans at all pilot sites are under preparation
Introduction of IPM methods and establishment of two pest centres generates carbon benefits of 30191 tCO2y over baseline

Location of two pest centres identified Required activities for equipping and running of pest centres with laboratories and early warning system are in progress Site based interventions pestspecific action plans data management of integrated pest management strategy are elaborated with the Department of Pest Management A list of required equipment and training needs drafted A national Integrated Pest Management Consultant was hired Yearly intervention plans at all pilot sites are under preparation

description.narrative: Fire management and carbon losses from fires

comment.narrative: Suppressionfocused fire management system annual carbon losses at five pilot sites average 3629 tCO2y
Proactive prevention and load management focussed fire management methods at pilot sites generate carbon benefits of 1646 tCO2y over baseline

Site based interventions forest unit based mitigation options fuel management strategies are elaborated with the Department of Fire Combating and academia A detailed plan for integrated fire management system a list of required equipment software and training needs drafted Terms of Reference for national consultant prepared and an Integrated Fire Management consultant hired Yearly intervention plans at all pilot sites are under preparation
Proactive prevention and load management focussed fire management methods at pilot sites generate carbon benefits of 1646 tCO2y over baseline

Site based interventions forest unit based mitigation options fuel management strategies are elaborated with the Department of Fire Combating and academia A detailed plan for integrated fire management system a list of required equipment software and training needs drafted Terms of Reference for national consultant prepared and an Integrated Fire Management consultant hired Yearly intervention plans at all pilot sites are under preparation

description.narrative: Policy and institutional framework for integrated forest management within landscape
MRV for forestbased mitigation and sequestration

comment.narrative: No MRV
One MRV for forestbased mitigation and sequestration in Turkey is developed with initial emphasis on Mediterranean region

A detailed activity plan to deploy MRV for forestbased mitigation and sequestration prepared by the project team and endorsed by the GDF LULUCF Unit academia and Forest Information System coordinator within GDF have been consulted along with the GoldStandard Foundation A project cooperation agreement was drafted to undertake activities to prepare MRV starting in the second half of 2015
One MRV for forestbased mitigation and sequestration in Turkey is developed with initial emphasis on Mediterranean region

A detailed activity plan to deploy MRV for forestbased mitigation and sequestration prepared by the project team and endorsed by the GDF LULUCF Unit academia and Forest Information System coordinator within GDF have been consulted along with the GoldStandard Foundation A project cooperation agreement was drafted to undertake activities to prepare MRV starting in the second half of 2015

description.narrative: Forest sector Nationally Appropriate Mitigation Action NAMA

comment.narrative: No NAMA
One fully developed NAMA covering 24 million ha Mediterraneanregion forests

The Steering Committee and the LULUCF Unit was consulted on the NAMA issue since the position of Turkey on eligibility is under question As a result of the Steering Committee decision it was decided to undertake consultation with the Ministry of Environment and Urbanisation the Focal Point of the UNFCCC to elaborate Turkeys position on NAMA According to the advise from the Ministry of Environment and Urbanisation it was decided to wait for official communication from the Secretariat of UNFCCC Once the official communication will be finalised the MoEU will share the decision with the Steering Committee and the LULUCF Unit of the GDF
One fully developed NAMA covering 24 million ha Mediterraneanregion forests

The Steering Committee and the LULUCF Unit was consulted on the NAMA issue since the position of Turkey on eligibility is under question As a result of the Steering Committee decision it was decided to undertake consultation with the Ministry of Environment and Urbanisation the Focal Point of the UNFCCC to elaborate Turkeys position on NAMA According to the advise from the Ministry of Environment and Urbanisation it was decided to wait for official communication from the Secretariat of UNFCCC Once the official communication will be finalised the MoEU will share the decision with the Steering Committee and the LULUCF Unit of the GDF

description.narrative: Forest protected area regulatory framework

comment.narrative: No legal framework defining forest PA expansion and integration within broader landscape
Effective regulatory framework enables GDF to establish forest PAs based on combined SFM criteria including biodiversity and carbon

The GDF and related departments identified needs and process for amending regulation on forest PAs Required data from Component 3 identified to understand the scale and scope of the amendment in the Protected Forests Regulation It is decided to start the legislative works upon justification of biodiversity conservation needs for permanency and integrity through field surveys in the Pilot sites
Effective regulatory framework enables GDF to establish forest PAs based on combined SFM criteria including biodiversity and carbon

The GDF and related departments identified needs and process for amending regulation on forest PAs Required data from Component 3 identified to understand the scale and scope of the amendment in the Protected Forests Regulation It is decided to start the legislative works upon justification of biodiversity conservation needs for permanency and integrity through field surveys in the Pilot sites

description.narrative: LULUCF Unit

comment.narrative: No properly capacitated LULUCF Unit in the Government
One adequately staffed and funded LULUCF unit with technical capacities to drive forest carbon efforts forward in the country

One adequately staffed and funded LULUCF unit established Capacity needs assessment is under implementation List of names roles and responsibilities and organisational structure are modified according to project needs LULUCF Unit already started their works on INDC calculation of LULUCF sector and other related works in according to the requests from the Ministry of Environment and Urbanisation and Ministry of Foreign Affairs Role of LULUCF Unit on forest based MRV and NAMA identified Upon capacity enhancement activities LULUCF Unit will lead the MRV and NAMA related activities
One adequately staffed and funded LULUCF unit with technical capacities to drive forest carbon efforts forward in the country

One adequately staffed and funded LULUCF unit established Capacity needs assessment is under implementation List of names roles and responsibilities and organisational structure are modified according to project needs LULUCF Unit already started their works on INDC calculation of LULUCF sector and other related works in according to the requests from the Ministry of Environment and Urbanisation and Ministry of Foreign Affairs Role of LULUCF Unit on forest based MRV and NAMA identified Upon capacity enhancement activities LULUCF Unit will lead the MRV and NAMA related activities

description.narrative: Carbon benefits from forest Pas

comment.narrative: Areas are subject to regular logging according to management plans carbon pools diminishing
Net carbon benefit associated with new conservation areas estimated at 64245 t CO2eyear

Biodiversity rapid assessment is under implementation Initial maps are produced according to biodiversity importance Final maps with new protected forests will be ready in 2016 According to the final maps and biodiversity requirements logging schemes will be revised with calculations on net carbon benefits in 2016 All calculations will be in line with MRV system to be developed under Outcome 1
Net carbon benefit associated with new conservation areas estimated at 64245 t CO2eyear

Biodiversity rapid assessment is under implementation Initial maps are produced according to biodiversity importance Final maps with new protected forests will be ready in 2016 According to the final maps and biodiversity requirements logging schemes will be revised with calculations on net carbon benefits in 2016 All calculations will be in line with MRV system to be developed under Outcome 1

description.narrative: Extent of forest PAs

comment.narrative: Mediterranean forest habitats are underrepresented in national PA system
Effective protection extended to 79960 ha including underrepresented Mediterranean forest habitats

Identification of 79960 ha Protected Forests through rapid biodiversity assessment and integration into forest management plans of 5 sites started Biodiversity rapid assessment for 6 taxa large mammals small mammals birds herpetofauna butterflies plants and ecological assessment within all pilot sites under implementation with involvement of several academia forest directorate officials at site level and biodiversity branch of the GDF Identification of silvicultural activities in line with biodiversity targets underpinned by rapid assessment carried out in 5 pilot sites Preparation of Forest Biodiversity strategy and action plan for GDF including national and local capacity assessment studies have been elaborated with the GDF Upon discussions it was decided to undertake such activities on capacity assessment next year upon obtaining results of the ongoing rapid assessment Two books on biodiversity and forest management prepared and published for forest engineers at national and local level
Effective protection extended to 79960 ha including underrepresented Mediterranean forest habitats

Identification of 79960 ha Protected Forests through rapid biodiversity assessment and integration into forest management plans of 5 sites started Biodiversity rapid assessment for 6 taxa large mammals small mammals birds herpetofauna butterflies plants and ecological assessment within all pilot sites under implementation with involvement of several academia forest directorate officials at site level and biodiversity branch of the GDF Identification of silvicultural activities in line with biodiversity targets underpinned by rapid assessment carried out in 5 pilot sites Preparation of Forest Biodiversity strategy and action plan for GDF including national and local capacity assessment studies have been elaborated with the GDF Upon discussions it was decided to undertake such activities on capacity assessment next year upon obtaining results of the ongoing rapid assessment Two books on biodiversity and forest management prepared and published for forest engineers at national and local level

description.narrative: Improvement in biodiversity indicator species at pilot sites

comment.narrative: See baseline values for pilot sites in table below
See target values for pilot sites in table below

Field studies for all taxa started last year As of 30 June 2015 consultants are in the field with the forestry officials for the surveys for large mammals small mammals birds herpetofauna butterflies and plants Habitat suitability assessment are also under implementation 10 orchids identified while one is local endemic Ophyrs amanensis subsp antalyansis in one pilot site Distribution maps prepared and biodiversity friendly forestry activities drafted
See target values for pilot sites in table below

Field studies for all taxa started last year As of 30 June 2015 consultants are in the field with the forestry officials for the surveys for large mammals small mammals birds herpetofauna butterflies and plants Habitat suitability assessment are also under implementation 10 orchids identified while one is local endemic Ophyrs amanensis subsp antalyansis in one pilot site Distribution maps prepared and biodiversity friendly forestry activities drafted

description.narrative: To promote an integrated approach to management of forests in Turkey demonstrating multiple environmental benefits in high conservation value forests in the Mediterranean forest region
Area of forest landscapes in Turkey with integrated forest plans developed and under implementation that deliver multiple environmental benefits biodiversity climate change ha

comment.narrative: 045 mln ha

Project initiated several activities at site level and headquarter level to enable the legislative and organisational structure for ensuring integration at landscape level While the target level at end of the project ie 045 mln ha will be achieved through cumulative effect of all progress at each outcomes current contribution of outcomes is promising with several facts as following i LULUCF unit established and MRV action plan prepared ii Process for amending legislation and site based activities are in line for producing technical and policy level justifications iii site based interventions for mitigation activities ie fire and pest management solar water heating systems and enhancement of carbon stocks silvicultural activities are detailed in an integrated approach at 125000 maps iv rapid biodiversity assessment at all pilot sites started some taxa already mapped along with silvicultural implementation plans
045 mln ha

Project initiated several activities at site level and headquarter level to enable the legislative and organisational structure for ensuring integration at landscape level While the target level at end of the project ie 045 mln ha will be achieved through cumulative effect of all progress at each outcomes current contribution of outcomes is promising with several facts as following i LULUCF unit established and MRV action plan prepared ii Process for amending legislation and site based activities are in line for producing technical and policy level justifications iii site based interventions for mitigation activities ie fire and pest management solar water heating systems and enhancement of carbon stocks silvicultural activities are detailed in an integrated approach at 125000 maps iv rapid biodiversity assessment at all pilot sites started some taxa already mapped along with silvicultural implementation plans
